Fields.DialogueText: What are you staring at?

Fields.MenuText: Just keeping watch, like you.
I was just thinking that you look pretty awesome. Black looks good on you.
Nothing... don't mind me.

Fields.DialogueText: Not like me, I'm actually useful.
Compliments? Really? You realize this is war, right?
Whatever, I don't even care. Just don't get in my way.
So are you sensing any Morganas around?
Yes, a rather large group to the north. I suggest we stay back and strike when the moon arrives.
You think we can take them all on our own?
I think they'll underestimate me the same way you seem to. You'll both learn a lesson after this battle.
I... did she just threaten me?
@BATTLE
Ouch.
It's the truth. Can you sense Morganas?
You have a point.
Camicia, to what do I owe this pleasure?
There are Morganas approaching us.

Fields.MenuText: What? Sound the alarm! We're about to get in a fight!
Is this a joke? You don't seem that worried.
Hopefully just a few.

Fields.DialogueText: You can calm down. I'll be lucky if I work up a sweat.
I've seen bigger fleets. It'll hardly be a battle, more like a scuffle.
My thinking exactly. You and I are of like minds.
At the rate they are moving, they'll be here any minute. I'll send them to the grave the minute after that.
I know you're confident, but we should probably still sound the alarm.
If you must, you must. I'll be on deck.
I can't tell if she's overestimating her own abilities or underestimating the Morganas.
I assure you it's neither.
*BOOM*
And it's here.
@BATTLE
Capitano, there's a small gathering of Morganas to our southwest. Would it be appropriate to change our heading?
Sounds like a plan. That is our job, right?
Exactly. I'm glad to see you agree.
This is more like it. I might even work up a sweat.
You said it was a small group of Morganas!
This is small. Don't tell me you're ready to run and hide behind your mother's skirts, Capitano!

Fields.MenuText: I'm no coward. Let's destroy some Morganas.
Well, when you say it like that...
Maybe, if I could just find somewhere to hide.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the attitude I'm looking for from my capitano.
I'm done talking. It's time for these Morganas to meet their maker.
Well, you can do that. I'll be here doing your job. Fighting Morganas.
All right, let's fight!
@BATTLE
Morganas approaching off the beam!
@BATTLE
The thing we need most is ammunition. The way Camicia has been fighting, we might as well get as much as we can.
Yes, Captain.
Is that a comment about my aim?
Uhhh, I'll get right on it, Captain.
Oh, I gotta g--
Not so fast there, Capitano. Do you have something to say about my shooting?

Fields.MenuText: No, not at all. I'd never badmouth you.
I'm sorry, I have no idea what you're talking about.
Well, it needs a little work, if I'm being completely honest.

Fields.DialogueText: No... of course you wouldn't. You're too smart for that.
I'm beginning to question whether that head of yours has any ideas in it.
Hmmm... honesty? I suppose you're not speaking completely without merit.
Oh, you!
Ma'am?
Give. Now.
Here. I believe they're the right brand.
These'll do. On your way.
Cigarettes?
I was starting to run out. Now I can finish off this package.
But you already have one in your mouth.
Any other obvious things you want to point out?
No, enjoy your smokes.
I'm planning on it.
Have you heard the stories about her?
There are stories? I just thought she was kind of... scary.
No, she's right. People have already started talking about her. She's turning into a myth, or something like that.
A myth? Seriously?
He's not wrong. They call her the Unseen Storm. They say you never see her approach until she's right on top of you.
And then it's only a second before you're destroyed, like a rowboat in a hurricane.
No, that's not right. They call her the Fog Demon. On nights of heavy fog, all sailors tremble, for they know that Camicia Nera is not far behind with weapons drawn.
How do you think she gets to her enemies unseen? Through the fog. Then bam, the storm swoops in, leaving hardly a trace of the massacre.
You can't have a storm and fog. Don't they cancel each other out?
Fog clouds, storm clouds. They're both clouds.
No, I think he's right. I don't think you can have fog and rain...
We are getting off track, my point is...
Eavesdropping, are we?
They're not exactly keeping it down.
Do you believe what they're saying about me?

Fields.MenuText: It sounds like you.
Sounds like a fun story to scare children.
Nah, you're too nice.

Fields.DialogueText: It certainly does, doesn't it?
Scare children, huh? I'm not sure whether or not I should take that as a compliment.
Nice? That's certainly something I've never been accused of being before.
So is it true?
You'll have a chance to find out. There are a few Morganas east of us. When you're done eating, we should take them on.
I'll eat fast, then.
You better.
@BATTLE
*BOOM*
This isn't going well, Camicia!
It's going exactly according to plan.
Our plan went out the window when we started losing!
I didn't say your plan. You may be losing, but I'm not. Not yet anyway.
Captain, they're readying another barrage. What are we doing?
We don't run. Not until absolutely necessary. We can still win.

Fields.MenuText: Listen to her... what else can we do?
Are you crazy?
I give the orders here!

Fields.DialogueText: Not the most supportive claim, but it's better than nothing, I suppose.
I'm not crazy! I'm Camicia Nera, and I'll tear all of my enemies apart with my teeth if I have to!
Then order them to follow me!
Do as she says. We can still win this fight... I guess.
Follow my every order! If you can't keep up, get out of the way so someone else can!
@BATTLE
You know, I'm the most valuable person on this ship right now, perhaps even in this whole war.
Did you come into my office just to stroke your ego?
No, I had a point. You should take my suggestions seriously. It could mean the difference between life and death for our entire crew.

Fields.MenuText: I'll keep your suggestion in mind.
I look to you as valuable council. I hope you know that.
I don't mean any offense, but I don't see you as the most level headed advisor.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose that's all I can ask.
You could've fooled me, the way you were questioning me before.
I don't care how you see me, I'm still worth listening to.
I'm not saying you should make me co-capitano or anything, I'm just saying I know what I'm doing.
Captain, you've received a transmission.
Camicia, I understand what you're saying. And I agree with you... mostly. I can promise I'll consider everything you've said.
I don't give a damn. Do what you will!
What was that transmission?
*ALARM*
Great, and I'm sure she sensed them too. Hope she doesn't hold a grudge for long.
@BATTLE
Looks like the fog's rolling in.
Cute. Why are you bothering me, Capitano?
I received a message earlier, from one of my friends up north. Apparently there are particularly powerful Morganas up there causing some havoc with their trading ships.
Havoc? Hmmm... how powerful are these Morganas of theirs?

Fields.MenuText: Nothing you can't handle.
She might be able to give the legendary Fog Demon a run for her money.
Strong enough. I didn't ask for details.

Fields.DialogueText: Then maybe they should get some other Belle's assistance.
Hmph, you know, that's the name I despise the least.
It doesn't matter. They all die the same.
It would seem we have our next destination. We should make haste.
I'm glad we could agree.
Before that, would it be all right if we took a small detour?
A detour? Where?
To the east, there's a group of Morganas. They're not heading for us, but I'd like to dispatch them all the same.
I'll alert navigation.
No, please allow me, I'd rather approach my prey unseen.
She definitely earned those names of hers.
@BATTLE
So where are these Morganas I'm here to kill?
What?
The powerful Morganas that have been causing havoc? I'd like to fill their graves now.
I think there might've been a miscommunication. We didn't come here to kill the Morganas. We're here on an escort mission.
I was promised powerful foes, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: Technically, I didn't promise anything.
I'm sorry, I didn't mean to send you the wrong message.
You could still end up fighting them, you know.

Fields.DialogueText: You think you're getting out of this on a technicality?
I don't need your apologies, I need some action.
... Explain. Quickly.
We're escorting the trading ship to protect it from the Morganas. They could attack at any time.
"Could," huh? I suppose it's better than nothing.
Hey, hear that? Maybe they're here already.
I hope not. If it's what I'm sensing, it'd be a complete let down.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Hello! I'm the captain of the Camicia Nera, and my ship and I will be escorting you as soon as we're done at port.
Call me Carter - it's not exactly nice to meet you under these circumstances, but I'm glad you're here all the same.
My crew and I are eager to ship out, so as soon as you're ready, we're good to go.
Hear that? We can leave right now if we want.

Fields.MenuText: We still need to restock, Camicia.
No, I didn't hear that. I must be getting old.
You have a point. I guess we could leave right away.

Fields.DialogueText: I guess we are running low on ammunition... Fine.
Old like a fox...  I suppose I'll have to wait for the crew to pick up more of your denture cream.
Yes. I like what I'm hearing. Say more.
Captain, we're picking up a group of Morganas heading here in our wake.
Looks like I get my fight after all.
Sound the alarm! And Camicia, tone down the smile. I don't want you scaring our charge before we're even on our way.
@BATTLE
I suppose you'd use a lot on the Morganas.
More than you'd think.
I heard that.
Denture cream?
Ignore her. She's just eager to get on the road.
Don't feel like you can't resupply on our account.
I suppose, if you insist.
Damn.
Could they be going any slower?

Fields.MenuText: They're moving as fast as they can.
Not everyone has a Belle to bring out the best in their ship.
I suppose they could just stop altogether.

Fields.DialogueText: It's still not fast enough. I'll be out of cigarettes before we're even halfway there, at this rate.
Sounds like a ton of excuses to me.
Don't give them ideas. Please.
I suppose the longer the journey takes, the greater the chance we'll be attacked by those powerful Morganas.
There you go, look on the-- Well, I guess it's not exactly bright.
One capitano's dark is another Belle's bright.
I won't bother judging the silver lining in your fog cloud, as long as it keeps you going.
*ALARM*
Now that, that would really keep me going.
I'm glad you're on our side.
For now, at least.
Oh, God, I hope she's joking.
@BATTLE
Morgana patrol spotted!
@BATTLE
Morgana after Morgana, and no sign of the challenge I was promised.
We're hardly halfway there, Camicia, have a little faith.
Faith is for the stupid and the blind. I threw away my faith long ago and filled the hole it left behind with strength.

Fields.MenuText: Strength is important, especially in wartime.
Everyone needs faith, it's what keeps us going.
You know, when you say stuff like that, it reminds me of why people started creating legends about you.

Fields.DialogueText: It's important at all times. Ruthless strength and bravery separate the winners and the losers of the world. Guess which ones have faith.
You can keep your faith, Capitano. My strength will drive me forward to the end of this war.
Heh, people can say what they want. I don't give a damn what they think. It doesn't affect me in the slightest.
This battle isn't worth the time and effort I've put into it any more. If you need me, I'll be in my room.
You're not keeping watch anymore?
I'm sure the crew has it handled. I'll still come to fight. Don't worry about that, Capitano.
I wasn't worried. You wouldn't sit out a fight. I know that much about you.
Good. You pay attention.
Can you believe it? The other day, she actually talked to me!
Seriously? What did she say?
"You're in my way. Move." For a second, I thought she was going to pull her guns on me.
Yeah, did you feel the fog roll in, too? Were you zapped by lightning? Did a unicorn jump out of the ocean?
What?
He doesn't believe me.
Of course I don't. I'm not even sure she can talk. Plus, I'm pretty sure she'd be more likely to just shoot you if you were in her way.

Fields.MenuText: Guys, calm down, she's just a--
I believe it. She's not the kind of person to turn a gun on her own crew.
I think she'd more likely just shove him out of the way. A gunshot would make too much of a mess.

Fields.DialogueText: A person? Is that what you were going to say? Because she's not, she's a Belle.
Yeah, she might be scary, but I don't think she's evil or anything.
Well, she did shove me, too, but it was after she told me to move and I just stood there with my jaw dropped. I don't blame her.
You. Give me a cigarette. I'm running low.
Uh... me?
Do you see anyone else here with a pack of cigarettes?
Oh, uh, okay, here you go, ma'am.
Hmmm, not my brand, but it's better than nothing. I appreciate it.
Uh, no problem.
Oh. My. God. You just had a conversation with the Unseen Storm!
And you're still standing.
See, guys, she's not that bad. She's just like you and me. Except for the whole spirit of a ship... thing.
*ALARM*
Yeah, very convincing, Captain. We'll keep that in mind.
Heh, yeah, but right now, we've got some Morganas to shoot at.
@BATTLE
Camicia, are you there? I wanted to let you know we're almost at our destination. It shouldn't be long now.
And still no sign of those Morganas? I'm beginning to think you were making up stories.

Fields.MenuText: I only told you what I was told.
Maybe all the stories about you scared it away.
I thought you didn't care anymore. What happened to that?

Fields.DialogueText: So it was a hand me down lie? Doesn't make it any better.
Heh, I doubt those tales have reached any Morganas. Though that would be flattering.
I don't care. But I can still be angry, can't I?
Ugh, just let me know when we make port. I need to restock.
Yeah, you're really wearing that cigarette down to a nub. Is that your last one?
No. I have one left, but it's called rationing. I'm not wasting a single millimeter of my smokes.
*ALARM*
Looks like we have company.
It would seem so. Better make sure that weakling trading ship doesn't sink to the bottom of the ocean.
Veiled threats? Relax, we're almost there.
@BATTLE
Capitano, I think they're here.
You mean the Morganas?
Yes. I'm not sure, but I'm sensing something big nearby.

Fields.MenuText: We're almost there, can we avoid it?
I hope you're ready for a fight then.
What do you think we should do?

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe, but we're not going to.
I've been ready since we started this escort.
You're not that stupid. You know exactly what I want to do.
It's headed straight for us. We should sound the alarms and get ready for it.
All right, I hope you know what you're doing.
And I hope these Morganas are as strong as I've imagined. It's going to feel good when I'm standing victorious.
@BATTLE
They're still not down?
Camicia, are you okay? You don't sound good.
I'm...  I'm fine...
*BOOM*
Capitano, we have to disengage and get as far from this beast as possible!
What? Are you giving up? I thought you didn't run.
I don't run! This is a strategic retreat. We can't fall here today, my power will be needed if we want to win this war.

Fields.MenuText: I want to do what you say, but...
We can't run, we have a charge to protect.
Stop stroking your ego and get that big head of yours in the fight!

Fields.DialogueText: But nothing!
Casualty of war, they knew what they were getting into. They'll die so we can live, it's a noble sacrifice!
What did you just say? Should I turn my guns on you?
We're not running... wait...
That's right, if there was ever a time to listen to me it would be now.
Start heading south, but keep firing at the Morganas, keep its attention on us so Carter and his ship can make it to port.
Yes, Captain.
This is not what I meant when I said run, Capitano.
It's coming in for another round.
All right, if I have to fight, I damn well better win. Everyone on me! Do as I say and we might come out of this on top!
@BATTLE
The Morganas are looking worse for wear now.
We're looking worse for wear, Capitano. If we keep up like this, we'll end up in sinking alongside it.

Fields.MenuText: It'd be worth it to take beasts like these down.
I won't let that happen. We can rush to port for repairs as soon as we defeat it.
Is that really what you think?

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing is worth our lives.
Port better be as close as you think it is. We might already be taking on water.
I don't lie, Capitano.
Just stop it with the defeatist attitude, Camicia. Isn't this the fight you were looking for?
A fierce battle is refreshing, a battle to the death is the opposite. Anything is better than facing your demise.
Forfeit, betrayal, cowardice... All these things are better alternatives to you?
If I'm alive then yes. The "how" doesn't matter.
Well, I hate to break it to you, but as long as I'm captain, we're going to stand and fight. But that doesn't mean I'll let you or anyone else die.
They're gaining on us again!
Well, let's see you prove that, right here and now.
@BATTLE
Huff... huff...
They're on their last legs!
So are we.

Fields.MenuText: Come on, things are looking up. We could win this.
I know, but we're on the last leg of this fight. They're almost down.
Don't think about it, just fight.

Fields.DialogueText: We could do a lot of things.
I repeat: so are we.
You know what... that's the best advice I've heard from you yet.
Damn it all to hell! This is not where I end!
@BATTLE
We did it.
Those are massive Morganas whose raiding days are over.
How is the ship looking?
Could be better. We need to make it to port sooner than later.
Then pick up the pace. I better not have to say it twice!
You can drop the scowl, Camicia, the battle is over.
The final shot we took made me drop my last cigarette in the ocean...
I see. I'll give you some space.
Smart.
Thanks, Captain. We would never have made it if you hadn't accompanied us.
You're welcome, I'm just glad we both made it here alive.
Some better off than others.

Fields.MenuText: Go wait for your cigarettes to come in.
At least we got the kill, and the bragging rights.
Well, you're not wrong.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not just going to sit in my room like a house pet, waiting for her master to come home.
You expect me to go and start bragging to the other Belles or something? No thanks.
I never am.
Well, we'll be here for a while, until our business is done. We should be able to make it back home without your escort thanks to your work dispatching that beast.
I have a feeling we'll be here a while. I'm not sure how long repairs are going to take. We might be here longer than you even.
I wish you luck then. And thanks again.
You, too.
He's a nice guy.
No backbone. I'm going to go watch for Morganas. If any look our way, they'll surely see an easy target.
Let's hope they don't then.
Whoa, that's not at all what I was saying.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Finally, give it here!

Fields.MenuText: Your cigarettes finally arrived?
Is that my honey baked ham?
So demanding, can't you ask the officer nicely, for once?

Fields.DialogueText: You got it. It feels like forever since I've felt the sweet relief between my lips.
Honey baked ham? What? No, he got my cigarettes. Or at least he better.
I shouldn't even have to ask. He should be smart enough to just give them to me.
Here you go, ma'am.
Perfect. Now leave.
He took off running. Smart man.
It took longer than I expected for him to pick them up for you. Are they rare or something?
It's a very specific brand of Italian cigarettes. Anything else doesn't taste right.
Whoa, that logo looks like poison. I'm not sure how safe those are.
Ha, please, Capitano, no one could be hurt by a little cigarette like this. It feels too good to be bad.
Captain, we're picking up a group of Morganas nearby. They're circling closer and closer to port.
How are repairs going?
Good, Captain.
Then we're okay to fight. It's just a few meager Morganas. We can wipe them off the map quickly enough.
Get the crew on board and sound the alarm. We're heading out.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
It looks like we have more.
I hope we can take them easily.
Captain, our repairs are not entirely complete. We should avoid too many hits.

Fields.MenuText: Camicia, do you have anything to add?
I wasn't planning on getting hit. I'm glad our plans are aligned.

Fields.DialogueText: We're fine. We'll tear them to pieces before they even see us.
What a brilliant plan. How did I never think of it?
@BATTLE
How are we looking?
We should be fine.
I knew we would make it out all right.
You're so confident despite the fact that we keep almost dying.
We must have two very different definitions of the word "almost."
Did we have to return to port so soon?
We can head back to open water as soon as all repairs are done.
I don't suppose I have a choice. I just don't feel right sitting around doing nothing when our comrades are out there fighting. It makes me feel lazy.

Fields.MenuText: You're definitely not lazy.
Everyone needs a break now and then. Enjoy it.
You're too hard on yourself sometimes.

Fields.DialogueText: I know that. It doesn't change how I feel.
When you say it like that... hmmm, maybe.
I'm hard on myself at all times. That's the secret to improving.
Well, if you want to feel useful, I'm sure there's something you can help out with around the ship.
I'm a warrior, not a mechanic.
True, but, no one knows the ship better than you. And wouldn't you love to order some people to do their jobs better?
You make a convincing point, Capitano. Maybe I'll go below deck and see where they can improve.
Sounds like a wonderful idea, Camicia. You do that.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Captain, we're good to go.
The repairs are finished?
The repairs, and a few upgrades that Camicia Nera ordered after looking around. We should be running at a hundred and ten percent now.

Fields.MenuText: I'm surprised to hear that she was actually helpful.
I knew she'd do well below deck.
Make that a hundred and twenty. I'm sure a hundred and ten wouldn't be enough for Camicia.

Fields.DialogueText: You're surprised? I'll keep that in mind next time you want my help.
I do well everywhere. But thanks for your confidence in me.
Why put a ceiling on it? Leave room for this ship to surprise you.
Camicia, where'd you come from? I didn't see the fog roll in.
I'm starting to get tired of that joke, Capitano.
Sorry. Are you ready to set out?
Do we have a destination?
Just patrol for now, but we might get called to deal with other tough Morganas in the future. Apparently word got out and Command is impressed.
And why wouldn't they be? I'm impressive.
*ALARM*
Looks like we already have a chance to show the crew what our ship can do.
Let's just try and keep it in one piece this time.
And who got it torn up last time?
Point made.
@BATTLE
Capitano, are you free?
Camicia?

Fields.MenuText: That depends on if you're here to kill me or not.
Sure, I can make some time.
Not really. I'm a busy captain and all that.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course not. You wouldn't see me if I was.
Good, because I wouldn't have left anyway.
Well, too bad, I'm not leaving until you have some of this with me.
Is that a bottle?
You're going to share a drink with me.
Well, I...
Shhh. Just drink.
Mmm, this is good. Is that... orange... and vanilla?
You have a good tongue, Capitano. This is Tuaca, it's my favorite liqueur.
Your favorite? Are we celebrating something?
Yes. You've earned my respect. I wasn't sure if you were a suitable capitano, honestly. But after all this, I think you've earned my allegiance.
Well... I guess I can drink to that.
Good, you're playing catch up. This is my second bottle.
Seriously?
I told you, it's my favorite.
I gotta say, it's really impressive watching you drink with the cigarette still in your mouth.
*ALARM*
If you think that's impressive, watch me destroy some Morganas with a gun in one hand, a bottle in the other, and a cigarette still between my lips.
Well... drunk Camicia might be more fun.
@BATTLE
Did you see her in that last fight?
I gotta say, it was pretty unbelievable.
She wasn't even looking at the final Morganas she shot down.
Yeah, she was too busy drinking to watch where she was shooting.
You gotta love a woman that can handle her liquor.
You guys fawning over Camicia again?
Maybe.
You gotta admit, she was pretty impressive.
You won't hear any argument from me.
Capitano? You in here?
Oh, over here, Camicia!
Oh geez, she's coming this way.
Be cool, be cool!
We didn't get to finish our drink. I've still got a glass with your name on it, Capitano.
I'll meet you in my office, then.
I'll see you there. Hurry, or your glass might end up empty. It is my favorite drink after all.
You, with the face. You're in my way. Move before I smash you under my heel like one of my cigarette butts.
Uh, excuse me, ma'am.
Mhmmmm.
Whoa, she's so scary.
So cool.
So sexy...
Wait, what?
Sounds like you have a problem.

Fields.MenuText: No, he's right. She's pretty smoking.
Yeah, Camicia's not a woman who's in the mood for love.
